episodeTitle: Magnificent Wings! My Name is Pell, Guardian Spirit of the Kingdom
description: Vivi discovers the bomb in the clock tower and defeats Mr. 7 and Miss Father's Day, but realizes it cannot be stopped. Pell makes the ultimate sacrifice by carrying the bomb high into the sky to save Arabasta. Meanwhile, Luffy continues his battle against Crocodile despite being poisoned by the hook.

events.title: Vivi vs Mr. 7 and Miss Father's Day
events.description: Vivi discovers the bomb inside the clock tower, but Mr. 7 and Miss Father's Day of Baroque Works are there to protect it. The duo speaks joyfully about firing the bomb as their last mission from their boss, hoping for a promotion.
events.significance: This confrontation stands between Vivi and stopping the bomb that could destroy all of Arabasta.

events.title: Zoro Takes Hit for Vivi and Chopper
events.description: While midair with only seven seconds left on the bomb timer, Mr. 7 and Miss Father's Day shoot at Vivi and Chopper. Zoro pushes them out of the way and takes the hit himself, allowing Vivi to reach the clock tower.
events.significance: Demonstrates the Straw Hats' commitment to protecting Vivi and stopping the civil war at any cost.

events.title: Vivi Defeats Mr. 7 and Miss Father's Day
events.description: Vivi defeats the Baroque Works pair using her Peacock Slashers, but realizes the bomb cannot be stopped easily as it has an active timer that she cannot disable.
events.significance: Vivi successfully reaches the bomb but faces the horrifying reality that she cannot stop it, creating a desperate situation for Arabasta.

events.title: Pell's Heroic Sacrifice
events.description: Pell arrives at the clock tower, transforms into his full falcon form, grabs the bomb, and flies it high into the sky above Alubarna. As he ascends, he declares 'I am Arabasta's Guardian Deity, The Falcon! And I am sworn to destroy the enemies of the Royal family!' The bomb explodes at high altitude, saving the entire kingdom.
events.significance: One of the most emotional and heroic moments in the Arabasta Arc. Pell's apparent sacrifice saves hundreds of thousands of lives and exemplifies his role as the kingdom's guardian. This scene became controversial when Pell later survived the explosion.

quotes.text: I am Arabasta's Guardian Deity, The Falcon! And I am sworn to destroy the enemies of the Royal family!
quotes.speaker: Pell
quotes.context: Pell's final words as he flies the bomb into the sky, moments before it explodes

events.title: Tashigi Confronts Baroque Works Agents
events.description: Tashigi attacks the men from Baroque Works and tells the Marines they should not hesitate and should immediately know who their enemy is. She leads her troops in suppressing Baroque Works henchmen throughout Alubarna.
events.significance: Shows Tashigi's growth as a leader and her understanding of her own sense of justice, putting aside the chase for the Straw Hats to help save Arabasta.

quotes.text: Don't hesitate! You should immediately know who your enemy is!
quotes.speaker: Tashigi
quotes.context: Tashigi rallying the Marines to fight against Baroque Works agents

events.title: Luffy Poisoned by Crocodile's Hook
events.description: Luffy continues to fight Crocodile, but the poison from Crocodile's golden hook has entered a wound on Luffy's shoulder, making his body numb. Crocodile laughs at how pathetic Luffy looks with the poison running through his body.
events.significance: Raises the stakes of the final battle as Luffy must now overcome both Crocodile's power and the deadly poison coursing through his veins. This demonstrates Crocodile's ruthless fighting style.

events.title: The Bomb Explodes Above Alubarna
events.description: The massive explosion occurs high in the sky above Alubarna, creating a brilliant flash visible from miles away. The citizens below are saved from certain death, but Vivi is distraught at witnessing Pell's apparent demise.
events.significance: The visual and emotional climax of the Arabasta Arc's bomb subplot. This moment represents the ultimate sacrifice for one's country and has become one of the most debated moments in One Piece due to Pell's later survival.

quotes.text: I am Arabasta's Guardian Deity, The Falcon! And I am sworn to destroy the enemies of the Royal family!
quotes.speaker: Pell
quotes.context: Final declaration before the bomb explodes

quotes.text: Don't hesitate! You should immediately know who your enemy is!
quotes.speaker: Tashigi
quotes.context: Rallying Marines to fight Baroque Works

themes.description: Pell's willingness to give his life to protect Arabasta exemplifies the ultimate sacrifice for one's homeland and duty as a guardian.
themes.symbolism: The falcon flying into the sky with the bomb represents ascending to protect those below, embodying the guardian spirit's role.

themes.description: Both Vivi fighting to reach the bomb and Luffy battling Crocodile while poisoned showcase unwavering determination despite seemingly insurmountable obstacles.
themes.symbolism: The ticking bomb timer represents the race against time and the consequences of failure.

themes.description: Multiple characters risk their lives to protect others - Zoro taking the hit for Vivi and Chopper, Pell sacrificing himself, and the Straw Hats fighting to save Arabasta.
themes.symbolism: The explosion in the sky rather than on the ground symbolizes taking the burden upon oneself to save others.

characterSpotlights.development: Pell demonstrates the ultimate fulfillment of his role as Arabasta's guardian by willingly giving his life to save the kingdom and its people.
keyActions: Arrives at the clock tower to help Vivi
Grabs the bomb and flies it high into the sky
Makes his final declaration as guardian deity
quotes: I am Arabasta's Guardian Deity, The Falcon! And I am sworn to destroy the enemies of the Royal family!

characterSpotlights.role: Desperate princess trying to save her people
characterSpotlights.development: Vivi shows her combat skills by defeating two Baroque Works agents but faces the heartbreak of being unable to stop the bomb and witnessing Pell's sacrifice.
keyActions: Fights and defeats Mr. 7 and Miss Father's Day
Discovers the bomb cannot be disabled
Is overcome with grief at Pell's apparent death

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy's battle with Crocodile intensifies as he must now overcome both his opponent's abilities and deadly poison.
keyActions: Struggles with the numbing effects of the poison
Refuses to give up despite his deteriorating condition

characterSpotlights.role: Marine leader exercising her own justice
characterSpotlights.development: Tashigi demonstrates leadership and moral clarity by directing Marines to fight Baroque Works rather than pursuing the Straw Hats.
keyActions: Rallies Marines to focus on the real enemy
Helps protect civilians and maintain order
quotes: Don't hesitate! You should immediately know who your enemy is!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended some of the emotional moments and battle sequences compared to the manga's pacing.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts manga chapters 206-208 and features one of the most controversial moments in One Piece - Pell's sacrifice and later survival.

Pell's survival from the bomb explosion, revealed in Episode 130, became one of the most debated topics among One Piece fans, with some theorizing that Oda changed the outcome due to sensitivity around the September 11 attacks, though this has never been officially confirmed.

sources.title: Undoing the Most Controversial Death in One Piece

trivia.fact: The golden hook used by Crocodile contains a hollow chamber filled with scorpion venom strong enough to melt through rock.
The episode aired in Japan on September 8, 2002, approximately one year after the September 11, 2001 attacks, which some fans have speculated influenced the handling of the bomb scene.
